subjectPost.name: All

cmCourseInfo.description: An introduction to the problems, theories and research [strategies central to the interdisciplinary field focusing on the nature and organization of the human mind and other cognitive systems. Interrelations among the philosophical, psychological, linguistic and computer science aspects of the field are emphasized.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Cognitive Science

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

subjectPost.name: All

cmCourseInfo.description: How does the human mind work? We explore this question by analyzing a range of data concerning such topics as human rationality and irrationality, human memory, how objects are represented in the mind, and the relation of language and cognition. This class provides critical thinking and practical computational skills that will allow students to work with data in cognitive science and related disciplines.
cmCourseInfo.title: Data, Computation, and the Mind

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

subjectPost.name: All

cmCourseInfo.description: This course provides COG students with the opportunities to practice quantitative and qualitative evaluation and assessment methods in real world situations and juxtapose theory with practice. Placement activities will ground topics such as problem solving, logistics, decision making, etc., through practical application, individual and group / in-class critical reflection.
cmCourseInfo.title: Cognitive Science in Practice

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Advanced Independent Study. Not eligible for CR/NCR option. Students must submit an application form that includes a written proposal and confirms that a faculty member has agreed to supervise. Applications must be submitted to the UC Programs Office (UC 173) for approval by the Program Director. Applications are due before the first day of course enrolment. Application form is available at the University College website at https://www.uc.utoronto.ca/cognitive-science-courses.
cmCourseInfo.title: Independent Study
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: 15.0 credits and a minimum cGPA of 3.0
